website_summaries.verdict: The Rocketfish Universal Wireless Rear Speaker Kit can convert most brands of surround speakers to cordless operation for less than $100.
pros: integrated wireless receiver with dual 25-watt digital power amplifiers
works with most brands of surround speakers
cons: No remote control options--power must be left on or manually toggled with each use
the system's nondefeatable delay can sound too echoey on some program material

customer_reviews.title: Whats the beef??
customer_reviews.text: I don't get the negative reviews!! Yes,when I 1st hooked up I got no sound.Turned it off and back on again/changed wires/etc but guess what?? Dummy me didn't check the volume on the back of receiver and it was turned all the way down )) Hmmm-wonder how many "dummys" on here sent a working unit back? Granted,there will be a few flaws get past on the assembly line but they can't fix human error. Will update if things change.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I just installed yesterday. Using for two rear surround speakers, about 20 feet away from the receiver, with a couch in between them. The receiver's set up/tuning sequence thought the speakers were wired out of phase (they weren't), but gave me the option so skip, so I did and they work fine. No detectable lag or loss of signal. I installed without reading any instructions; just need to turn both units on, increase the volume on the receiving unit and hit a not particularly obvious "connect" button on the receiving unit.
customer_reviews.author: Rod of SATX

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from this
customer_reviews.text: Unit worked for 3 months. Then it suddenly quit. I researched the issue and found that other customers are having the exact same issue. I tried to get in touch with customer support and was transferred to India. I was just read back the troubleshooting info in the user guide which I already knew. Still the issue has not been fixed. I cannot get a refund anymore for this.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Chen

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap should be called bottomfish
customer_reviews.text: Piece of crap should be called bottomfish. Don't buy this unless you want two useless black boxes that has a blue light that indicates it's connected but no wireless delivered sound. Don't buy and save the frustration.
customer_reviews.author: zendogpc

customer_reviews.title: Never worked out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Hookup was easy with various cabling included, but units never "paired". Worthless. Tech Support/"Zac" simply says to send it back. That's what I'll do. It's a discontinued item, so keep searching for alternate units of wireless transmission to speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer S

customer_reviews.title: Great system!  Easy install. Make adjustments for sound delay, don't complain about it.
customer_reviews.text: I dont know what the fuss is about, but I needes rear speakers for my surround sound without the ugly wires. I run a Yamaha receiver with Bose speakers. I got everything installed in about 30 minutes. The sound was slightly delayed, which some people angrily gave 1 star over. BUT, magically, there's an adjustment on the receiver that adjusts the delay time. I made a slight adjustment and amazing!!! No delay. No staticy white noise, just beautifully clean sounds of explosions and violence thundering through my house. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Jake Wammack

customer_reviews.title: Not made to last
customer_reviews.text: My rocketfish died after several months. I actually had several of these, each of which quit after moderate use over several months. Also the manufacturer customer support is non existent.
customer_reviews.author: Jason West

customer_reviews.title: No brainer!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know what some of these negative reviewers are doing, but as an audiophile, the setup is easy as hell, and surprisingly produces a clear sound and zero latency. No static, hiss, or any feedback noise, and I have a lot of equipment.. Very surprised.. I’m sure the difference between those that have negative experiences vs those of us who have great experience, is some just throw cables around and leave everything a mess and unorganized from the look of the photos. My wires are well organized and managed as I take the time to make things clean. Highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Good work around for surround
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a work around for my rear surround set up until I had time to set the wiring up in my movie room. I have them connected to some Klipsch bookshelf speakers, no issues to report. As a temp solution I have to admit the sound as not as bad as I thought.
customer_reviews.author: Mayo

customer_reviews.title: Not 10' through a hollow wall.
customer_reviews.text: Just got this home and hooked it up. Trying to get sound to my home speaker system from my bonus room tuner to the hookups in a closet. The units are literally less than 10' apart through a standard hollow sheetrock wall and the sound is intermittent if it is there at all. I'm not sure how they work with line of site but I wouldn't bet on anything close to 100 feet.
customer_reviews.author: Bernie Cobb

customer_reviews.title: Best Option To Go Wireless
customer_reviews.text: Have a new house, and we have no basements here. Didn’t want to pay to have the electrician put in wiring as it limits where you can place your speakers. So I decided to go wireless. I tried these units and they were super easy to set up, and they work perfectly. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: David Allen

customer_reviews.title: Will quit working in a few months
customer_reviews.text: Had it plugged into my two rear speakers and my denon receiver. It lasted a few months, then for some reason produced no sound. Tried troubleshooting and rewiring, but nothing seemed to work. Just stopped working randomly.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup and works for me. Saw negative reviews, but I didn't have the same problems. Doesn't have the best sound quality but my rear channel speakers weren't that great sounding when they were hardwarded so I think the Rocketfish did it's job.
customer_reviews.author: Reggie Woo

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after a year. Then troubleshooting was impossible. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Fran

customer_reviews.title: Wireless Receiver
customer_reviews.text: Using in dining room for bookshelf speakers tied into main receiver in family room. Avoided having to run longer cables. Just make sure the receivers are not obstructed as signal will degrade.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Lack of Power
customer_reviews.text: Does not have enough power for larger speakers, seller will not take it back.
customer_reviews.author: Amie Higginbotham

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing though if you just need them for a living ...
customer_reviews.text: Not as loud as I needed them to be, had to return. Works amazing though if you just need them for a living room though. Slight buzzing noise when they are running though.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Haven't touched them since installation
customer_reviews.text: They just work. Stereo receiver and sub-woofer are in a rack mount in spare bedroom closet. Rear speakers are in the living room. Everything hides under the couch and I've never had a single disconnect or issue with them. A++ would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: dendritic_growth

customer_reviews.title: Internal capacitor issue
customer_reviews.text: After 3 weeks of on-and-off use, one of the internal components blew up which turns out to be a capacitor. Consequently the receiver would no longer work. If it had lasted this would be a useful product. I think the engineers should think about changing this component with a better-quality component.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: No tech support whatsoever
customer_reviews.text: After this unit failed - it worked for about 3 months - I tried to get the issue resolved by contacting tech support. Well, it turns out that there virtually is no such thing. After 3 failed attempts I eventually gave up. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: James B

customer_reviews.title: No joy
customer_reviews.text: Simply did not work. Following instructions with reset etc. Never paired with rear remote speakers.
customer_reviews.author: davrober

customer_reviews.title: Sensitive Electronics
customer_reviews.text: The idea behind the process, and the price for how much it can do, seems about right. And the 80% positive reviews looks nice. But buyer beware, because Rocketfish will not honor any warrantee for a product purchased on-line. I bought one and managed to set it up just fine, but something in the wiring of my home (and my sister's when she tried it) caused some painful-sounding static that almost blew out my speakers. Not even using a surge protector solved the problem. Now I'm stuck with this and I can't use it in my home. You might be better off buying from the retailer or their partner Best Buy so you can get support.
customer_reviews.author: Myr Herder

customer_reviews.title: Cheap capacitors
customer_reviews.text: One of the internal capacitors has blown up after just 2 weeks of continuous use. This product in my opinion was made with inferior materials. One other reviewer has posted a picture which is exactly what happened to me. Good to know that there are other people with the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: So Far, So Good
customer_reviews.text: The only problem I've encountered with this product is the occasional need to "re-sync" the sending unit and the receiver. The key is in knowing where the "connect" button is on the receiver--which is NOT the same as the power button. Since I've figured out that little detail, it's been smooth sailing, and it is really great not having to run wires all across my living room to get full-on 5.1 sound.
customer_reviews.author: John Baldridge

customer_reviews.title: Flawless
customer_reviews.text: I had a high end wireless speaker system that died after about 5 years and was looking for an alternative that wouldn't break the bank. I wish I had just ordered this unit to start as I tried others that were horrible and had lots of static. This unit works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: M. Stern

customer_reviews.title: It constantly looses signal
customer_reviews.text: I live in italy where all the walls are made out of cement and there is no option to run wires through the edge of the floors, so i bought this product in hopes that it would help me out and I regret every sencond of it! It will only last maybe 30 minutes before it looses connection with the reciever and bey bey surround sound. If it was far appart i would understand, but the reciever is litterallly within 20 feet! DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Cortes

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had anything negative to report using this device since I've installed it a few months ago. Hooked up the rear channel speakers and it linked itself almost automatically. I get true surround when it's available without stringing wires either on the floor, over the ceiling or in the walls. For big or odd shaped rooms it's a lifesaver and it allows us to have a surround system in our bedroom as well as one in the living room.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Hennigan

customer_reviews.title: 1 year still strong!!
customer_reviews.text: I have this for my rear Klipsch speakers and it works great! I have it paired for my 'Denon AVR-S500BT 5.2 Channel Receiver with 4K Capability and Bluetooth' and all together it works great. Total of 5.1 surround sound. 1 year old and still works like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: Jace P.

customer_reviews.title: One channel failed after one week
customer_reviews.text: This set was initially running flawlessly. Except for a slight background static, there was nothing really to complain about. Unfortunately, after approximately one week, one of the channels started missing a loud noise. After about one hour, it completely failed. At this point I'm just going to return the set because I don't have faith that a replacement would last any longer.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Guzman

customer_reviews.title: Works well with a catch
customer_reviews.text: This works amazingly well. I hooked it up to my 3 zone amplifier and now I have music in my entire condo. The only catch is that you have to ensure you adjust the volume on the receiver or have pretty beefy speakers to support the wattage delivered. But I turned the volume down on the zone and used the volume control on the remote device and all is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Sbrundle

customer_reviews.title: Hum
customer_reviews.text: I am getting a low-frequency hum on both channels which is independent from the sound that I feed into the transmitter component. So far I have failed in my attempts to eliminate this issue. Otherwise this is a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Carolin

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed. I just moved into a new house with no possible way to run speaker wire to the rear speakers in the family room. The setup was a breeze and compatible with my Onkyo receiver. I now have great surround sound. I had no issues with my wireless internet like others reported.
customer_reviews.author: irishlad

customer_reviews.title: Recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: We love this product. Connected easily and surround sound is awesome. No noises or cracking sounds reported in other reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Vidya Sagar

customer_reviews.title: Solved my wiring dilemma
customer_reviews.text: Moved into my new home in August. The media room has high, vaulted open beam ceilings and limited the options to run cable to the rear surround sound speakers on the back wall, some 20' away from the Receiver. The Rocketfish transmitting unit set up easily to the back of my Denon and the receiver was an easy fit into the closet at the rear of the room. No ugly wires, no lumps under the new carpet and a very solid, high quality sound from the rear surrounds. This unit is a very good value aesthetically and economically.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fagundes

customer_reviews.title: works as described!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: I had no trouble setting this up. I have no issues with sound quality - though I switched my home network to 802.11n just in case, since folks were complaining of interference. Cons: The speaker cable provided was way too short but thankfully I had some laying around. Sound volume - it can only be set statically on the rear receiver.. wish there was a way for it to update volume dynamically.
customer_reviews.author: Joey The Tap Water Buffalo

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: Product is defective. Seller sent another unit to replace broken sender unit - the replaced sender unit was also broken (it did not power on). I would not buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen White

customer_reviews.title: No tech support
customer_reviews.text: I contacted the seller because my set stopped working. I was referred to the manufacturer. I spent several hours trying to call tech support but none of the people I spoke to had a clue about the problem I have. What a waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Thomso

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: It worked for about 3 weeks and then one of the internal capacitors blew up with a big bang. One reviewer had posted a picture of the internals that shows the capacitor. Strange that this company is still using this component.
customer_reviews.author: Florian Dahong

customer_reviews.title: Will not pair up
customer_reviews.text: I spent the better part of the afternoon trying to sync up the 2 units - without luck so far. I am about to give up but will have my wife take another look later.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Pion

customer_reviews.title: Good but not durable
customer_reviews.text: I had 2 sets of these. The first worked for close to 13 months after which the signal started breaking up. Replaced it with another set last week figuring that the problem had been resolved. After 1 week one of the outputs has a high-pitched noise that is driving me nuts.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy H Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Wonderfully Wireless
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup, hastle free, sounds great. While only a moderate audiophile I was very impressed with the fact that there is no noticable loss of quality when using this device. Transmitter is on top of receiver in an entertainment center, reciver nicely tucked behind the couch. No un-sightly wires. This sold my fiance on the purchase of a home entertainment center ;)
customer_reviews.author: D. Clawson

customer_reviews.title: Static
customer_reviews.text: Even though this works over the specified wireless range, I still ended up returning this because of the constant background hiss that is ever present.
customer_reviews.author: SSH

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, just what I needed to complete my surround sound system.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wireless with issues
customer_reviews.text: This was supposed to be a problem solver for our master bedroom. We could not run speaker wires. This worked but once this is turned on I can no longer connect with my laptop to our access point which is in our living room.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Foster

customer_reviews.title: Broken speaker clip
customer_reviews.text: One of the units arrived with a broken speaker terminal thus making it impossible to connect the unit to my audio source. I am trying to figure out if there is a workaround. Thus far I have not been able to come up with one though.
customer_reviews.author: Dean L

customer_reviews.title: Stopped after one week
customer_reviews.text: This worked for a week but suddenly stopped. I have tried to get help from Rocketfish but their customer support is non-existent. I am glad I purchased on Amazon so I can get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Terrible tech support
customer_reviews.text: Product broke within the first week. There is virtually no way to get in touch with anybody who is knowledgeable at Rocketfish. I do think that they are outsourcing their tech support.
customer_reviews.author: Turko S

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.text: The first one worked flawlessly. So I bought a second one. I'm using them to power the back channels on vintage Marantz quad systems. The front channels run through a powered subwoofer on both systems. There was no way to run wires. I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: ruggles

customer_reviews.title: Super easy
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Much easier than running wires all over the place.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Van Note

customer_reviews.title: No matter how I try I can't get it to ...
customer_reviews.text: No matter how I try I can't get it to work I even had av company try to get it to work they can't make it happen
customer_reviews.author: john luzzi

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw
customer_reviews.text: I think there`s a design flaw with this kid. The receiver unit which connects to the Sioux speakers is getting extremely hot. After one day, the receiver totally quick. I sent it back to the manufacturer and received the replacement one week later. However, the same problem occurs on the replacement receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Katarina Kumbatiadis

customer_reviews.title: Just works
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product before and it finally died after 7ish years of service. I tried other products and they were a horror show so I simply repurchased a rocket fish and all is well in the kingdom again. Setup is a breeze and sound quality is great.
customer_reviews.author: Dude

customer_reviews.title: A good wifi for rear speakers.
customer_reviews.text: I love this. It helps extend my 5.1 to reach rear speakers. I am getting consistently good signal and no drop-outs.
customer_reviews.author: JayDreamer

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality - Easy Set Up
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to set up; I wish I had purchased them long ago. The receiver sits on the floor against a wall behind the couch. The transmitter and receiver synced up right out of the box, I didn't have to do anything. The instructions were very clear. This is a great product at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Tom43876

customer_reviews.title: Two duds in a row
customer_reviews.text: While the seller quickly provided a replacement after my set quit working, the second set only lasted 3 weeks. I am satisfied by its performance but reliability is another story.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Great home theater rear speakers solution!
customer_reviews.text: Excelent product! It solved my home theater cable installation problem in minutes. I am an audio engineer and this system works flawlessly. You just plug it in and that's it! The sound quality is great and I have never heard any interference noise. I really recommend this kit to anybody that does not have the option of cable installation.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed. Works well with my Sony 5. ...
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed. Works well with my Sony 5.1 system. Just pay attention to directions: larger of the two boxes is what is connected to the rear speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon U.

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: This unit was doa. No sound whatsoever other than a slight humming noise. I am glad I kept the packaging so that I can return it.
customer_reviews.author: Faith B

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: If you can't or won't run wires from your AVR to rear surround speakers, this will do it for you neatly. I don't know how it compares with similar products, but given that the speakers don't sound as good as they did hard-wired to the AVR, the sound is good enough for surround-sound rear speakers.
customer_reviews.author: David Turkheimer

customer_reviews.title: Great Solution for Surround Rear Speakers
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fantastic! Need a solution for you 5.1 or 7.1 surround back speakers that you can't run wires to, this is it. The price compared to its competitors makes it a no brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Jim R

customer_reviews.title: Broke
customer_reviews.text: Worked for 2 months. Now the receiver no longer syncs up. Called tech support but they are useless. I guess it is time to start looking for another option...
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: No more crawling under the house to run wires. Sounds great
customer_reviews.author: ramfan13

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: This unit sometimes overheats and then quits. I have to let it cool down in order to resume operation. What a drag.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Ramos

customer_reviews.title: good unit(s)
customer_reviews.text: This unit works really well. But in order to cut down on the number of wires, I got 2 of them and ran one rear speaker off one and the other rear speaker off the other.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Frank

customer_reviews.title: bought it as a 'refurb' but it's GREAT
customer_reviews.text: works without a hitch - set the device up under my couch and it still works like a charm accepting the signal from the main device - perfect way to setup and move surround sound systems without wires
customer_reviews.author: Gliese581

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the money.
customer_reviews.text: It works fairly well. It could have a little more power, and sometimes there is an echo from front to back due to the delay. I will see if my system can help with correcting that. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Witherington

customer_reviews.title: One fish, two fish, red fish, dead Rocketfish
customer_reviews.text: Used the Rocketfish system to power a pair of Bose bookshelf speakers with an Onkyo, and most recently Denon amp. Overall the sound quality was fine. However there were several flaws and the life of the unit was about three years. I would occasionally hear a popping noise from the speakers, even when the amp was turned off. The transmitter and receiver had to be paired multiple times throughout the life of the unit. Seems like as long as this has been on the market- significant improvements in quality would have been made the company, or a competitor would have built a better mousetrap.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Of the mixed reviews on this item I wasn't sure on this. I have been doing home audio for a long time. This product is great, no buzzing, great sound and easy to hook up.
customer_reviews.author: BiggieSmalls

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Wish they include more wiring. Had to buy own.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Taijeron

customer_reviews.title: works great, and when you don't want to run speaker ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for about a month, works great, and when you don't want to run speaker wires all over it is the best option!
customer_reviews.author: OMGWTFBBQ

customer_reviews.title: I should have heeded the reviews
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this on 6/10/2018 and discovered 7 months later that the transmitter will now not power on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Failed
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 2 weeks. Then suddenly it stopped for no apparent reason. I still have warranty but I think I just may return this for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Thom Corrigan

customer_reviews.title: Works very well, cheap alternative to getting professional installation.
customer_reviews.text: Product is now a week old and working well. Very impressed, only has a slight white noise when nothing is playing. You can not hear it unless you put your ear next to the speaker. For the price, it is a great deal and I Recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: C3Troop

customer_reviews.title: Smoke!
customer_reviews.text: The sound from this wireless unit was quite decent. However after around 20 minutes I noticed that there was an odor coming from the bigger unit. After another 30 minutes I noticed some some. I immediately turned everything off. I am afraid that this unit is not safe.
customer_reviews.author: Kinga Korpacz

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Rocketfish!
customer_reviews.text: I received my product in a very timely manner. Upon opening the box I found everything to be in order. When I connected my Rocketfish to my Sony Bravia System it worked immediately and the sound was incredible. I love the fact that there are no wires running around my living room. If you want surround sound without all the wires then I suggest you purchase the Rocketfish System. You will not be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: JMcQueen

customer_reviews.title: Worked until it died
customer_reviews.text: For when this worked it worked great. It did impact our WiFi a bit but by relocating the transmitter unit we were able to pretty much solve that issue. However it quit working last night in the middle of watching a movie. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy

customer_reviews.title: quit working after 2 month
customer_reviews.text: quit working after 2 month of normal usage. worked great until then
customer_reviews.author: Karen Dieminger

customer_reviews.title: Interference
customer_reviews.text: This set does work even if there is wireless interference. The big issue though is that it kills my wireless network entirely. The only option would be to upgrade to a 5 GHz wireless network.
customer_reviews.author: John Lievense

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a good product. I wanted to be able to have rear speakers on my home theater without running wires. This worked perfectly for that purpose. I didn't need a lot of power and this system is not a high-end system. It's great for that. I also bought one of these so I could have a pair of speakers by my pool outside without running wires. You have to watch the distance, but when you are in range, bingo! It would be nice if Rocketfish has a second channel option. Then you could have one for one zone or rear channel and another for another zone.
customer_reviews.author: CautiousBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Left channel faulty
customer_reviews.text: This arrived fast. However there is some static on the left channel regardless of how far away the transmitter unit is away. I swapped speakers and the issue is still on the left channel.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Serotta

customer_reviews.title: Cuts out
customer_reviews.text: I have no problems pairing the 2 units. However the sound drops out frequently. Even pairing this again will not resolve this. Both units are around 20 feet apart both located on the floor of my master bedroom. I do not have any other wireless devices.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Top Notch ! Great solution
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff really easy to hook up ! Ive had no interference with wifi or anything, quality is great and the wifey is happy because there is no cables lying around. Top notch product so far !
customer_reviews.author: CESAR JUNIOR NARVAEZ

customer_reviews.title: Rocketfish Rocks
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to use as my rear speakers in my living room for my 5.1 Surrround system. They fired right up after I installed and sound great. We I watch movies now that are 5.1 Surround - wow, what a differece. And I did not have to run any wires. Happy camper here.
customer_reviews.author: chuckcdm

customer_reviews.title: These are working great for me in a large apartment complex where I'm ...
customer_reviews.text: bought these to replace my more expensive and dead (after 1 year) wireless sound cast unit. These are working great for me in a large apartment complex where I'm sure everyone has wifi and tons of wireless devices.
customer_reviews.author: brandon cowen

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Wireless rear speakers Cons: Died after 1 year Had to constantly re-pair them
customer_reviews.author: Kevo

customer_reviews.title: Rocketfish wireless rear speaker kit
customer_reviews.text: Instead of spending hours hiding wires it's plug and play. I love the price and my speakers sit about 22 feet away and sounds great. Thanks for the on time delivery, very happy
customer_reviews.author: Michael Noerling

customer_reviews.title: No wires
customer_reviews.text: These are across the room from my home theater system. They are crisp and clear, but best of all, there are no wires.
customer_reviews.author: Polite and Kind

customer_reviews.title: Look Ma!  No Wires!
customer_reviews.text: Really easy plug n play. Works great. I keep the "receiver" and speaker wires tucked under the couch for a clean application.
customer_reviews.author: Clay

customer_reviews.title: Get 7.1 surround sound with no rear speaker wires, no drilling of holes and no crawling in the crawl space!
customer_reviews.text: I used two of these to provide wireless connection to my four rear speakers. Sounds great and my wife is happy that we didn't have to drill and pull wires. The two transmitters have to be out front of the hardware in the entertainment center, but it does work well!
customer_reviews.author: Reid Christenberry

customer_reviews.title: 2 stars
customer_reviews.text: I cannot get clean sound with this unit. There is some hiss which changes in pitch depending on where I place the wireless receiver. I am not sure what I am doing wrong. When connecting the speakers directly to my source there is no noise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ingenious item at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Considering the huge hassle it would be to bury the cables to my rear home theater speakers under the carpet (which I can't do anyway because I rent an apartment), this things is tremendous. No sound issues, no connectivity problems, simple setup, very compact and unobtrusive. No, it's not truly WIRELESS, but that's beside the point. This will enable the floor between your couch and your TV to be wireless so you're not tripping over wires. It works with almost any home theater setup too, so no worries about compatibility. Oh, and it won't cost you an arm and a leg either.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel A. Dougan

customer_reviews.title: Nothing spectacular, it delivers what it promises. Don't ...
customer_reviews.text: Nothing spectacular, it delivers what it promises. Don't expect it to be loud, it's rather discrete. Quality of sound just average, but that's what I was looking for: affordable wireless transmission.
customer_reviews.author: MarioM

customer_reviews.title: Not worth for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bad quality doesn't work and seller don't accept returns already a slot for connecting cables blow the spring and pressure point
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wireless Speaker
customer_reviews.text: This wireless unit is great, Sound is great and easy to hook up.
customer_reviews.author: Happy

customer_reviews.title: Installed per instruction, would not connect, tried several ...
customer_reviews.text: Installed per instruction, would not connect, tried several times with negative results. Did not expect problems so tossed packages, did not return ate the loss.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor performance (esp. considering price)
customer_reviews.text: Interference is a constant concern -- loud static/pops after only a few minutes of use. The connection between the transmitter and receiver often fails to establish after repeated resets, or turns off after a minute of use. The distribution of sound is erratic and unbalanced. It seems not to properly interpret DTS and Dolby stereo encoding. Not since initial setup have I been able to watch an entire movie without disconnection, extremely loud interference, inconsistent sound levels, or just deciding to turn it off because it was so disruptive. Sonus appears to provide a workable and affordable alternative at much higher fidelity and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Saxdrop

customer_reviews.title: Would not pair
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions to the letter but the receiver would not pair to the transmitter. I do not have anything that could interfere with the signal.
customer_reviews.author: Marcey Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Not good ...
customer_reviews.text: This arrived fast but it did not work properly. We fiddled with the location of each item and even turned off our wifi to accomodate this. Yet we could not get a steady connection.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Broken speaker clip
customer_reviews.text: When I set this up, one of the speaker tabs on the transmitter snapped right off. Too bad really since this interrupted my setup and now I have to send back the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Spoiled Brad

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: The two units simply will not sync up. I pushed the button on either unit several times but they do not connect. I even tried swapping the wallwart on the smaller unit.
customer_reviews.author: Alia

product_meta.title: Rocketfish Universal Wireless Rear Speaker Kit RF-WHTIB-A
product_meta.description: This wireless kit sends rich sound to your home entertainment system speakers while eliminating ugly and cumbersome wires. Just plug the sender into your home theater and your rear speakers into the receiver.
feature_bullets: Provides uncompressed CD-quality audio to rear speakers without the use of wires
Multiple mounting options, including horizontal, vertical in the included stand or wall-mounted
Includes sender, receiver with stand, two 2" sections of speaker wire, AC adapter and user manual
